Ce premier prêt lui permettra d’acheter,  5 pièces de pagnes wax et  2 colis de tasses à Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso) et qui seront vendus à Sikasso de façon ambulante à une clientèle composée essentiellement des femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 130 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, payer le prêt et contribuer aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Sanata, who was born around 1968 in Tonfouga in the commune of Bougouni, is a married woman who is mother to four children and who lives with her husband and children in a nuclear family in Banconi, one of the outer distircts of the town Sikasso (the Republic of Mali's third administrative region). Having carried out a large number of unsuccessful activities, she began buying and selling "pagnes wax" (highly decorative and colourful pieces of fabric) and kitchen utensils around five years ago. 

With a view to responding better to ever-increasing customer demand, she decided to join the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, around two years ago. After four solidarity (group) loans with a women's association from her neighborhood, she is now on her first individual loan. This first loan will allow her to buy five pieces of "pagnes wax" and two parcels of cups in Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso), which she will sell on a door-to-door basis in Sikasso to a customer base made up essentially of women. 

With this loan she expects to make a monthly profit of 130,000FCFA, which will be used principally to expand her business, repay the interest on her loan and contribute to family expenses.

loans.use: to buy a variety of items

loans.name: Chauv

texts.en:
Mrs. Chauv has been operating a small sales business from her home. In the morning she sells fish porridge to local people in the community. She also sells biscuits, sweet things and packaged food, especially for young children. From this business, she is able to generate income of $1.50 per day. At present, Chauv has two young children who are under her care. 
Chauv would like to take out a loan from Kiva partner HKL to purchase a small piece of land next to her present house. Her future goal is to own a proper store for selling different types of products.

loans.use: to purchase a small piece of land next to her present house.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: Rafael con su anterior credikiva anterior, compró mercancía que vendió y también le alcanzó para invertir en materia prima e insumos para confeccionar ropa de todo tipo, con la que también le fue muy bien. Su negocio ha mejorado mucho, adquirió dos máquinas recientemente y sus ventas se han incrementado. En la actualidad Rafael quiere aprovechar la época de diciembre, donde sus ventas se incrementan y la rotación de sus productos es de contado,para elaborar nuevos diseños. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, con el cual comprará tela e insumos de confección, para vestir alegremente a las familias en las festividades de año nuevo . Rafael dijo a su asesor: Gracias, me han ayudado mucho a mí y a muchas personas que se benefician con los créditos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. "
texts.en: Rafael used his previous Credikiva loan to buy merchandise which he then sold, and also to invest in materials and supplies to make all kinds of clothing, which was very helpful.  Recently he has bought two machines and sales have increased.  Currently Rafael wants to take advantage of the December season when sales increase and there is greater turnover of his products, so he can come up with new designs.  This is why he is requesting a new loan to buy fabric and sewing supplies.  In this way he will be able to dress the families in a festive mode for the New Year's celebrations.  Rafael said to his counselor, "Thank you for helping me and many other people who benefit from the loans given through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.".

loans.use: To buy fabric and sewing suupplies.

loans.name: Chiep

texts.en:
Mr. Chiep is 49 years old and the loving father of seven children. He is a humble farmer who lives in Kompong Cham province. He is a very hardworking man who grows rice crops both in rainy season and in dry season.
To increase his household income, Chiep has bought some types of fish to raise in a pond next to his house in addition to managing his daily farming tasks. In order to sustain his two businesses, Chiep needs some capital to buy fish feed and to pay for the process of cultivating his dry-season rice. This is his first loan from HKL and Kiva. Chiep hopes that he’ll be able to make a good income and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fish feed and to pay for the cultivation of his dry-season rice.

loans.name: Mani

texts.fr:
Madame Mani est âgée de 54 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle  réside avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une famille nucléaire à Hamdallaye, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso .              
Madame Mani après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initiée à cette activité génératrice de revenus notamment à l’achat et à la vente des pagnes wax, et des articles en plastiques (Seaux, Bol, Gobelet, Assiette etc) depuis plus de trois ans. Elle achète ses marchandises à Bobo (Burkina Faso), avant de les revendre de façon ambulantes dans son quartier, au grand marché et au marché de Médine à une clientèle composée essentiellement des femmes de ménage. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida ainsi de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus d’un an. Elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel, le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé.
Ce deuxième prêt individuel lui permettra d’acheter 10 pièces de pagnes wax, 2 douzaines de baignoires  et  5 douzaines de seaux.
 Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 95 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en: Mani is 54 years old, married, and the mother of six children.  She lives with her husband and children in a nuclear family in Hamdallaye, one of the working-class neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso.  After being involved in many activities without much success, Mani decided to learn a new profitable trade, that of buying and selling wax-print "pagnes" (colorful West African fabrics) and plastic items (buckets, bowls, cups, plates etc.)  She has been involved in this business for over three years.  She buys her goods in Bobo (Burkina Faso) and sells them door-to-door in her neighborhood, at the Grand Marché and the marché in Médine.  Her customers are mostly cleaning ladies.  In order to satisfy an ever-increasing number of customers, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso over a year ago.  She has requested a second individual loan.  Her first loan was well repaid.  This new individual loan will allow her to buy 10 sets of wax-print "pagnes", 2 dozen tubs and 5 dozen buckets.  With this loan, she is expecting monthly profits to reach 95,000 CFA francs, which will be used to boost her business, contribute to family expenses and pay off her loan's interests.

loans.use: to buy wax-print "pagnes" and plastic items.

loans.name: Heiber Arley

texts.es: El señor Heiber Arley a sus 26 años de edad es un emprendedor quien desea iniciar su propio negocio de venta de comidas rápidas a las afueras de su casa en un carro adecuado para la elaboración y venta de este tipo de alimentos con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos puesto que con el trabajo que tiene actualmente en una empresa de carga en el aeropuerto del municipio de Rionegro localizado al oriente de Antioquia no es suficiente para cubrir los gastos y necesidades en su hogar, para lo cual el señor Heiber Arley necesita de la compra del carro para la venta de sus productos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Heiber Arley, 26, is an entrepreneur who wants to set up his own fast food business outside his house.  He would use a vehicle as a food stall to make and sell the food and, thus, improve his income.  The current job he has with a cargo company at the Rionegro municipal airport in east Antioquia does not provide enough income to cover household expenses and necessities.  

Heiber Arley needs to buy a vehicle to sell his products so he can improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a vehicle to start up a fast food business.

loans.name: Luís Iban

texts.es:
El señor Luís tiene 32 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y un hijo.

Luís se ha dedicado a desempeñar las actividades agrícolas, y desde hace dos años esta trabajando en el cultivo de hortalizas, trabajo que aprendió de su papá. Luis es una persona muy trabajadora, honesta y responsable. Él necesita abastecer el mercado de una comunidad, ya que tiene muchos clientes a los que les vende tomates, maíz, fríjol, chile, pepino, entre otros.

Los insumos como fertilizantes, semillas, fungicidas, insecticidas, los compra en una ciudad que esta a siete kilómetros del lugar donde vive. Debido a que Luís necesita abastecer el mercado, él solicita un préstamo a la Fundación Campo para comprar, semillas de maíz, fríjol, tomate, pepino, insecticidas, fungicidas y pago de mano de obra, para cultivar 10,500 metros cuadrados de tierra. Así él obtendrá más ganancias, porque aumentara el número de clientes y le permitirá ahorrar, darle una mejor vida a su familia y dentro de poco tiempo solicitar un préstamo con un monto mayor para aumentar la cantidad de tierra para cultivar más.

Don Luís desea ampliar su vivienda, tener una pecera, una granja de pollos de engorde y de gallinas ponedoras.
texts.en:
Luís is 32 and lives with his common-law wife and son.

He works in agriculture and for the last two years has been growing vegetables, a trade he learned from his father.  Luis is hard-working, honest and responsible.  He supplies to the community market and has many customers who buy his tomatoes, corn, beans, chili peppers, cucumbers and other produce.

He buys the supplies he needs such as fertilizer, seeds, fungicides, and insecticides in the city which is seven kilometers from where he lives.  In order to continue selling crops at the market he is requesting a loan through Fundación Campo to buy corn, bean, tomato and cucumber seeds, insecticides and fungicides, and hire workers to plant 10,500 square meters of land.  He will be able to make more money this way since he will increase his customer base and be able to save and give his family a better lifestyle.  In the near future he wants to ask for a more significant loan to increase his cropland.

Luís wants to expand his house, adding a fish pond, and a farm to raise chickens and hens.

loans.use: To buy corn, bean, tomato, and cucumber seeds; insecticides; fungicides: and hire workers to plant 10,000 square meters of land.

loans.name: Lundaajantsan

texts.en: Mr. Lundaajantsan, 55, runs a second-hand clothes stall selling garments that have been imported from developing countries. He lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, with his wife and his son. Lundaajantsan has been running his business for seven years and already has many permanent customers. Now he feels it is time to increase his working capital to expand his sales volume in order to improve and increase his earnings. The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase second-hand clothes from his suppliers in large amounts.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Ismaël

texts.fr:
Né en Août 1984 à Sikasso, Monsieur Ismaël est un célibataire qui réside dans une grande famille traditionnelle à Médine, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ismaël ayant pas eu la chance de progresser dans les études s’est initié à cette activité d’achat et vente des pots de fleurs et ustensiles de cuisines, il y a environ sept ans. Son activité est menée dans une boutique au nouveaux marché de Médine Sikasso avec une clientèle composée de toutes les couches sociales. Il est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Il décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ une année. Il a bénéficié d’un crédit qui a été correctement remboursé. 
Dans le but de mieux relancer toujours ses activités, il sollicite ainsi un deuxième crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter à Bamako 20 cartons de pots de fleurs de marques différentes, 3 cartons de tasses Aluminium, 5 cartons d’assiettes, 2 douzaines de cuillères et 2 douzaines de fourchettes. 
 Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en: Ismaël was born in August 1984 in Sikasso.  He is single and lives in a large traditional family in Médine, one of the working-class neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso (third administrative district of the Republic of Mali).  Ismaël did not get the chance to progress in his studies, and about seven years ago, he learned how to get involved in the business of buying and selling flower pots and kitchen utensils.  He sells these items in a shop located in the new market of Médine, in Sikasso.  His customers come from all socioeconomic groups.  He is a very popular seller, thanks to the quality of his products.  In order to better satisfy an ever-increasing number of customers, he decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso about a year ago.  He was granted a loan which was properly repaid.  In order to further enhance his business, he is requesting a second loan which will allow him to buy 20 boxes of flower pots (of various brands), 3 boxes of aluminum cups, 5 boxes of plates, 2 dozen spoons and 2 dozen forks.  He will buy these items in Bamako.  He is expecting monthly profits to reach 200,000 CFA francs, part of which will be used to contribute to his family's expenses, pay off his loan's interests, while the rest will be invested in his business.

loans.use: to buy various retail items.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 
Annabelle has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has run this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages for resale.
Annabelle has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, canned goods and beverages.

loans.name: Nandintsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Nandintsetseg, 31, is a secondary school teacher in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. She has been teaching in the school for five years and lives with her family in a common apartment. Nandintsetseg wants to make renovations to the apartment because it is old and needs window insulation. During the winter time there is too much heat loss through the broken windows. Therefore she is requesting a loan to purchase the building materials to make repairs.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to make some repairs to her apartment.

loans.name: Oyunbold

texts.en:
Mr. Oyunbold is a 39-year-old married man and father of two beautiful daughters. He lives in an outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia, without  basic infrastructure. His elder daughter is a student in a local university while his five-year-old daughter stays at home with her mother. 
Oyunbold's family has operated a small sewing factory for 12 years. They sew a variety of clothes, which they sell at the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. The family business has improved day by day, and therefore Oyunbold wants a car to support the business. He is requesting a loan of 2,400,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) to buy a new car.

loans.use: to buy a new car to support his business.

loans.name: Boanerges Arcides

texts.es:
Boanerges, vive con su madre, está soltero, no tiene hijos, la casa es familiar, él se dedica a administrar un restaurante, lleva 10 años en el negocio, inicio como empleado y poco a poco se fue posesionando hasta que hoy lo administra.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de alimentos como: carnes, pollo, aceite, condimentos, verduras, y otros que son necesarios para estar preparado para atender la demanda de los clientes.
Su aspiración es mantener siempre la fidelidad de los clientes, por eso invierte en mejoras pues le ayuda a crecer y estabilizarse.
texts.en:
Boanerges lives with his mother.  He is single, with no children, and lives in the family home.  For ten years he has been in the restaurant business.  He began as a restaurant worker and little by little became skilled enough to run a business.

Currently he is requesting a loan to buy food ingredients such as meats, chicken, oil, condiments, vegetables and other items he must have on hand to be able to meet customer demand.  He aspires to maintaining customer loyalty and therefore wants to invest in improvements that will help him grow and become stable.

loans.use: To buy meat, chicken, oil, condiments and vegetables.

loans.name: Diénèbou

texts.fr:
Née vers 1975 à Mampè Préfecture de Sikasso,  Diénèbou  est mariée et mère de 5 enfants et réside chez son époux et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle à Sanoubougou I Kapel Kourou, un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après plusieurs activités sans succès, elle s’est initié il depuis plus de 8 ans à cette activité de commerce d’articles divers notamment l’achat et la vente d’éventails, de vannes, de paniers et de nattes qu’elle amène du marché de Sarro (région de Ségou) avant de les revendre à sa place au marché où ses marchandises sont beaucoup sollicitées de sa clientèle, composée essentiellement des des femmes de ménage et de vendeuses de condiments, pour leurs qualités.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de deux années. Elle sollicite ainsi un quatrième crédit pour augmenter son fonds de commerce afin d’acheter, 40 colis colis d’éventails. 
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce crédit un bénéfice mensuel de 250 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Diénèbou was born circa 1975 in Mampè, in Sikasso Prefecture. She's married and the mother of five children. She lives with her husband and children in a large traditional family in Sanoubougou I Kapel Kourou, an outlying neighborhood of the city of Sikasso (Third Administrative Region of the Republic of Mali).

Eight years ago, after several unsuccessful businesses, she became familiar with buying and selling various items, in particular hand fans, baskets, and mats that she brings back from the Sarro market (Ségou Region), before reselling them at her spot at the market.

Thanks to their quality, her products are very much sought after by her clientele, which comprises mostly housewives and condiments resellers.

Two years ago, eager to better satisfy her ever-increasing clientele, she decided to join Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso. She's now seeking her fourth loan to bolster her working capital, in order to buy 40 boxes of hand fans. 

Thans to this loan, she intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 250'000 (ca US$ 485), to be used to bolster her working capital, help with the family expenses, and pay the interests of her loan.

loans.use: to buy 40 boxes of hand fans

loans.name: Him

texts.en:
Mrs Him, age 41, is a diligent mother. She is in the business of making brooms to generate a daily income. She has many frequent customers who buy the brooms in bulk and then retail them from place to place. Sometimes Him acts as a retailer of the brooms as well. 
Presently, Him’s family does not own a vehicle so she has some difficulties in transporting her products anywhere further than her locality. To solve this problem, Him has asked for her first loan from Kiva to purchase a second-hand motorcycle to support her business and for family use. She is very appreciative of Kiva lenders and hopes that her business will improve further with her loan.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand motorcycle to support her business and for family use.

loans.name: Evelin Esmeralda

texts.es:
Evelyn, vive con su familia, su hijo,  su madre, ella se dedica a las labores agrícolas y ganaderas, pues son gente de campo, aprendió a trabajar con sus padres cuando era joven, para agilizar el trabajo, ella paga mozos quienes realizan la labor más fuerte.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como abono, herbicidas, semilla mejorada, además de comprarse una ternera para su crianza de ganado, esta compra le ayudara a tener todo lo necesario para empezar la siembra.
La aspiración de Evelyn es tener éxito en los cultivos, para poder ayudar a su familia, quienes dependen de ella.
texts.en:
Evelyn lives with her family, her son and mother.  She works in agriculture and livestock farming, as they live in the country, and learned her trade from her parents when she was young.  When there is hard work to be done she hires workers to help her.

Currently she is requesting a loan to buy farm supplies such as compost, herbicides, improved seeds, and also a young calf to raise. The purchase will help her have on hand everything she needs to begin planting.

Evelyn's goal is to have a successful crop so she can help her family, since they depend on her.

loans.use: To buy compost, herbicides and improved seeds.

loans.name: Clara Luz

texts.es:
Clara, vive con su esposo y tres hijos, ella junto a su esposo se dedican a la siembra de maíz, plátano y ajonjoli, el oficio lo aprendio de sus padres, ya tienen 23 años de realizar esta actividad, no tienen un horario establecido.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar los insumos agrícolas como plaguicidas, semilla, preparación de terreno y pagos de mozos, así como  alquiler de tierra,  puesto que son dos manzanas de terreno las que cultiva, de esa forma lograra obtener mejores resultados para  su familia viva.
El sueño de Clara es apoyar a su esposo en su trabajo y siempre mantener los ingresos necesarios para que no le falte nada a su familia.
texts.en:
Clara lives with her husband and three children.  She and her husband grow corn, plantain and sesame.  For 23 years she has been in farming since she learned the trade from her parents.  She has no specific work schedule.

The loan will be used to buy farm supplies such as pest control products and seeds, and to hire workers to prepare the land.  She also must rent two blocks of cropland to use, which will increase the family income.

Clara's goal is to support her husband in his work and always maintain the necessary income so the family does not go without.

loans.use: To buy pest control products, seeds and hire workers to prepare the land.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 60-year-old married man who has worked as a taxi driver for the past 30 years. He is a hard-working man who does his best for his family's living. Working as a taxi driver for this long period hasn't been easy, but he has to keep on because it is his only source of income.

To increase his business and income, Youssef is intending to buy a van through a loan for which he has applied for this reason from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to start a new business.  He will start transporting students from/to school which is a good source of income, since he has people's trust in most of the region in which he lives. Youssef hopes to expand his business and employ a few employees to help him in the future.

loans.use: To buy a van to transport school students

loans.name: Santos Leonidas

texts.es:
Santos, vive con su esposa  y dos hijos en casa propia, el se dedica a la sastrería, tiene 10 años de trabajar en este oficio, él  lo aprendió de un vecino, actualmente trabaja confeccionando uniformes escolares, no tiene un horario establecido.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar materiales para la elaboración de uniformes de las escuelas como: una mesa grande para cortar la tela, hilos, zíperes, botones y telas, de esa manera tendrá lo que necesita para sacar a tiempo sus trabajos y también mejorar sus ingresos.
La aspiración de Santos es siempre tener trabajo, arreglar su vivienda y también que su familia viva siempre en las condiciones adecuadas.
texts.en:
Santos lives with his wife and two children in his own house.  He is a tailor and has been in business for ten years.  He learned the trade from a neighbor and currently makes school uniforms.  He has no fixed work schedule.

The loan will be used to buy materials to make school uniforms such as a large table for cutting fabric, thread, zippers, buttons and fabric.  He will then have everything he needs to produce the garments on time and improve his income.

Santos aspires to having work always so he can renovate his house and make sure his family always lives in adequate conditions.

loans.use: To buy a large table for cutting fabric, thread, zippers, buttons and fabric.

loans.name: Maguette

texts.fr: Madame Maguette  est une femme mariée de 34 ans. Elle est mère de 4 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre un et 15 ans. Elle s’active dans le secteur du commerce plus particulièrement dans la vente de glace,  de jus et de parfums. Elle a choisi son activité par passion mais aussi dans le but de se procurer des revenus et aider sa famille. Ce qui l’intéresse  le plus dans son activité c’est son aspect lucratif. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC  de sa zone d’habitation et sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de sucre et de produits entrant dans la préparation de jus pour bénéficier de prix plus compétitifs . Ceci lui permettra d’accroitre ses bénéfices et d’améliorer les conditions sociales de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maguette, age 34, is married and the mother of four children, whose ages range from 1 to 15. Her business consists in selling ice, juices, and perfumes. 

She chose this business out of passion, but also with the goal of earning an income to help her family. She's mostly interested in the money-earning aspect of her business.

She's a member of the UIMCEC branch in her neighborhood, and she's seeking a loan of XOF 100'000, intended to buy sugar and other products needed to prepare juice, in order to get more competitive prices.

This will enable her to increase her profits and improve the social position of her family.

loans.use: to buy sugar and other products to make juice

loans.name: Arsenia Aydee

texts.es: Arsenia tiene 61 años de edad y su familia está conformada por ella su esposo y 08 hijos, la cual sigue apoyando a 01 de ellos. Arsenia lleva más de 10 años dedicándose  a la venta de bebidas como agua minera, gaseosas y cervezas, aparte prepara tamales, para luego venderlas ambulatoriamente, los ingresos que perciben es de mucha ayuda para ella  pues ha podido brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia el préstamo obtenido le servirá para comprar gaseosas, agua minera y cervezas y así tener que ofrecer a sus clientes. El deseo de Arsenia es de seguir trabajando positivamente y así seguir generando utilidades a su hogar. Arsenia esta agradecida con el crédito brindado.
texts.en:
Arsenia is 61 years old. Her family is made up of her husband and 8 children, of which she continues supporting one of them. Arsenia has made a living selling drinks like mineral water, soda and beer for more than ten years. Apart from this she prepares tamales to later sell in the street. The income she receives is very helpful as it allows her to offer a better quality of life to her family.

This loan will help her buy soda, mineral water and beer to have products to offer to her customers. Arsenia hopes to continue working positively and so continue providing income to her household. Arsenia is grateful for the help offered to her.

loans.use: to buy soda, mineral water and beer.

loans.name: Kathlen Marvely

texts.es: Kathlen, de nuevo solicita un nuevo préstamo con el objetivo de mejorar su negocio de ropa para niños, damas y caballeros comprar bolsos grandes para trasportar su mercadería ya que ella tiene que viajar a otros pueblos para vender su mercadería y también comprar: jeans, shorts, pantalones, camisas y ropa interior por el cual podrá obtener mejores ingresos. Los prestamos anteriores le ayudaron porque aumentaron en sus ventas y ha surtido su negocio ya tiene sus clientes que la prefieren.
texts.en:
Kathlen is requesting a new loan with the aim of improving her clothing business. She sells men's, women's and children's clothing and wants to buy large bags to transport her stock as she has to travel to other villages to sell her products. She also wants to buy: jeans, shorts, trousers, shirts and underwear which will enable her to obtain a higher income.

Her previous loans helped her because they increased her sales and her business now has customers who prefer buying from her.

loans.use: to buy jeans, shorts, trousers, shirts and underwear.

loans.name: Blanca Elizabeth

texts.es: Blanca Elizabeth es una emprendedora que inicio su propio negocio que es una pulpería, donde le brinda a sus clientes variedad de productos muchos de sus clientes son vecinos de la comunidad donde ella habita lo cual están satisfecho por la calidad  de servicio que le brinda. Este negocio inicio de la necesidad de pagar los gastos del hogar, ella nos expresa que este negocio le gusta y que es su mayor herramienta de trabajo. Blanca está solicitando crédito para invertir en el negocio en la compra de productos para la pulpería.
texts.en: Blanca Elizabeth is an entrepreneur who opened her own business, which is a small grocery store. There she offers her customers a variety of products. Her customers are residents of the community where she lives and they are satisfied with the quality of service that she offers. She started this business to pay for her household expenses. She has told us that she likes this business and that it her biggest work tool. Blanca is asking for the loan to invest in the business by buying products for her store.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products for her small store.

loans.name: Jose Raul

texts.es:
José, vive en casa propia, tiene tres hijos y su esposa, él vive de la administración de un molino de nixtamal a pare de otras labores agricultoras, su horario de trabajo es de 4:00am a 4:00pm, lleva 5 años en este negocio.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de un motor diesel, ya que este nuevo equipo ayudara a mejorar el funcionamiento del molino, dando un mejor servicio para los clientes.
La aspiración de José es que pueda montar un molino mejor, con más capacidad, para brindar un mejor servicio a los clientes.
texts.en:
José lives in his own house. He has three children and a wife. He makes a living running a corn mill alongside doing other agricultural jobs. His work timetable is from 4:00am until 4:00pm. He has been in this business for five years.

At this time he is requesting a loan to buy a diesel engine, as with this new equipment he will be able to improve the running of the mill and provide a better service to his clients.

José's dream is to set up a better mill, with a higher capacity, to offer a better service to his clients.

loans.use: to buy a diesel engine.

loans.name: Diakalia

texts.fr:
Né en 1986 à Zanièna préfecture de Sikasso, Monsieur Diakalia  est un célibataire résidant dans une grande famille traditionnelle à Kaboïla I, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso.  
Diakalia  a grandi dans le commerce car son père est un grand commerçant de la place. Il s’est très vite initié à cette activité d’achat et vente des motocyclettes (engin à deux roues de toutes marques). Son activité est menée dans sa propre boutique au grand marché de Sikasso avec une clientèle composée de toutes les couches sociales. Il est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Il décide d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel. 
Avec ce premier prêt il compte acheter, à Bamako, 2 mobylettes de qualités différentes, afin de les revendre dans son magasin. 
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour  contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en: Diakalia was born in 1986 in Zanièna, in the Sikasso Cercle.  He is single and lives in a large traditional family in Kaboïla I, one of the working-class neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso.  He grew up in a business environment, since his father is a well-known local business owner.  Diakalia very quickly learned to buy and sell motorcycles (two-wheeled vehicles of various brands).  He owns a shop at the Grand Marché in Sikasso and his customers come from all socioeconomic backgrounds.  He is a very popular seller, thanks to the quality of his products.  In order to satisfy an ever-increasing number of customers, he decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and has requested his first individual loan.  With this first loan he is planning to buy two different models of motorcycles.  He will buy these two vehicles in Bamako and will resell them in his shop.  Thanks to this loan he is expecting monthly profits to reach 200,000 CFA francs which will be essentially used to contribute to his family expenses and pay off his loan's interest, while the rest will be invested in his business.

loans.use: to buy motorcycles.

loans.name: Deysi Marlene

texts.es:
Deysi, reside con sus padres, es madre de dos hijos de 12 y 7 años, por los cuales el padre de ellos le ayuda económicamente, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, este lo realiza de manera ambulante, tiene año y medio de dedicarse a este negocio, su horario normal es de 8:00am a 6:00pm.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de mochilas para ofrecer en esta temporada de inicio de clases, tambien comprara una parte de ropa variada: ropa interior, centros para niños, calcetines escolares, entre otros, para que en este tiempo de temporada pueda generar más ganancias.
La aspiración de Deysi, es tener un negocio rentable, que pueda en un futuro comprarse un puesto en el mercado, para evitar caminar mucho ofreciendo la mercadería.
texts.en:
Deysi lives with her parents, and is the mother of two children ages 12 and 7.  Their father helps support them financially.  She dedicates herself to selling new clothing, an activity she carries out on foot.  She has been in this business for a year and a half.  Her normal schedule is 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. 

Currently, she requests a loan to buy backpacks for this season of the start of classes.  She would also use a portion to buy a variety of clothing:  undergarments, children’s clothing, and school socks among other items since, during this time, she can generate more income.

Deysi’s aspirations are to have a profitable business and to be able to eventually buy a stall in the market to avoid having to walk so much to sell her merchandise.

loans.use: buy undergarments, children's clothing, school socks and backpacks.

loans.name: Aleyda Marilu

texts.es:
Aleyda, vive con su familia, su esposo y dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de pan, antojitos, y verduras,  lo realiza todos los días y los antojitos solo por las tardes.
Actualmente Aleyda está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de pan dulce, condimentos, aceite, y otros ingredientes para la elaboración de su venta, este crédito le permitirá tener mayor rentabilidad en el negocio.
La aspiración de ella es mejorar el negocio a través del financiamiento de los préstamos, comprar y mantener productos de calidad para que los clientes se sientan satisfechos.
texts.en:
Aleyda lives with her family, her husband and two children.  She dedicates herself to selling bread, snacks and vegetables every day, selling her snacks only in the afternoons.

Currently, Aleyda is requesting a loan for the purchase of sweet breads, condiments, cooking oil, and other ingredients for her business.  This loan would allow her to generate more profits through her enterprise.

Her aspiration is to improve her business by means of financing through the loans, to buy and stock high quality products so that her customers feel satisfied.

loans.use: buy sweet breads, condiments, cooking oil.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es: La socia tiene continua con el negocio como comerciante minorista, ella tiene un restaurante, la socia invierte su credito en la implementacion de su restaurante, la socia desea invertir en la compra de insumos como arroz, aceite, fideos, al por mayor y para esto desea el credito para implementar su negocio.
texts.en: This member continues with her business. She has a restaurant and will  invest her loan in stocking the restaurant. She would like to invest in buying ingredients such as rice, oil, and pasta wholesale. That is why she wants the loan, to stock her business.

loans.use: to invest in buying ingredients such as rice, oil, and pasta wholesale.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is a 29-year-old married woman with 1 child who is still too young for school.  Her husband Shee is a fish monger who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs.  She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Mwanatumu has operated a fish selling business for the past 1 year; her potential clients are the local area villagers.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality.  She dreams of expanding her business.

With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase 100 kilos of fish and cooking oil for her business.  She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase 100 kilos of fish and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a 43-year-old married woman with 1 child who has completed school.  She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Mwanasiti has operated a food stall for the past 2 years; her potential clients are the local area villagers and the local school students.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality.  She dreams of expanding her business to a café.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase 10 liters of cooking oil, 10 kilos of beans and a sack of coconuts for her business.  She decided to join Yehu to access funds to uplift her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase 10 liters of cooking oil, 10 kilos of beans and a sack of coconuts for her business.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 50 years old and married with 5 children.  She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines.  Clarita is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Clarita has been farming sugarcane for 4 years and also earns additional income from a general store.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

This is her 2nd loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor Manuel es un emprendedor que inicio su propio negocio que es la venta y compra de ganado, este negocio lo aprendió de forma empírica ya que su papa se dedicaba a este negocio y ahora él se dedica al negocio además que tenía que generar ingresos a la familia para apoyar en los gastos  del hogar. Víctor Manuel esta solicitando financiamiento para comprar más ganado y realizar las compra y venta de este mismo.
texts.en: Víctor Manuel is an entrepreneur who started his own business, which is the purchase and sale of livestock.  He learned this business in an empirical manner, given that his father had the same type of enterprise.  He is now in the same trade because he had to earn income to support his family and the household expenses.  Víctor Manuel is requesting this loan to buy more livestock, and to realize the purchase and sale of the same.

loans.use: buy livestock.

loans.name: Yesenia Esmeralda

texts.es:
Yesenia, administra una tienda donde vende productos domésticos y antojitos, está casada, tiene tres hijos de 22, 16 y 10 años de edad, ella atiende el negocio desde hace 3 años, trabaja todos los días de 6:00am a 5:00pm, surgió por iniciativa propia.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de los antojitos como quesillo, pollo, carnes, condimentos, gaseosas, entre otros productos para mantener en su cocina y poder utilizarlos para la venta de antojitos.
Este préstamo le ayudara para mejorar la disponibilidad en el negocio, ayudara mejor a su familia y sobre todo a sus hijos en este nuevo año de estudio.
texts.en:
Yesenia runs a shop where she sells domestic products and snacks. She is married and has three children of 22, 16 and 10 years of age. She has run this shop for the last three years. She works every day from 6:00am until 5:00pm. Her business came about from her own initiative.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as cheese, chicken, meat, seasoning, soda, among other items, to make snacks. She will keep the supplies in her kitchen and use them to prepare the snacks.

This loan will help her improve her product range in her shop, it will help her family and, above all, will help her children in this new year of studies.

loans.use: to buy cheese, chicken, meat, seasoning, soda.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a 45-year-old married woman with 7 children, 4 of whom are enrolled in school while the rest have completed school.  She owns a house with electricity but no piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children.

Mwanasha has operated a food stall, selling mahamri, for the past 2 years; her potential clients are the local area villagers.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality.  She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to pay school fees for her children.  She decided to join Yehu to access funds to uplift her living standards.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a 45-year-old married woman with 3 children, 1 of whom is enrolled in school.  Her husband Yusuf is a farmer who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs.  She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Hadija has operated a food stall for the past 5 years; her potential clients are the local area villagers.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality.  She dreams of establishing a café in the future.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase 12 bags of maize flour, 25 kilos of rice and 10 liters of cooking oil for her business.  She decided to join Yehu to access funds to uplift her living standards and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase 12 bags of maize flour, 25 kilos of rice and 10 liters of cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
This is Victoria, age 55 and a resident of Manila, Philippines.  She is married to Danilo, and she is the mother to their five children.  She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating the business.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Victoria operates a variety store.  In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood.  It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil or an egg.  Antonia earns her income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece.  Her store is located adjacent to her house.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operationing her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan.  She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.  She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Victoria dreams to be able to give all of her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is 56 years old and married with 6 children.  She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines.  Guillerma is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Guillerma has been farming sugarcane for 3 years and also earns additional income from a motorcycle transport business.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de artesania,la socia vende chompas,polos,pantalones y chalinas,ella tiene una tienda donde atiende desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el local donde vende artesania.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar artesania como polos,chompas y chalinas al por mayor.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues devoted to her business selling crafts. She sells jumpers, polo shorts, trousers and chalinas (Peruvian scarves). She has a shop where she works from 9:00am until 5:00pm. By means of this business the member helps her children to get ahead. The member's dream is to extend her shops where she sells traditional crafts. 

The member is requesting a loan to buy traditional products such as polo shirts, jumpers and chalinas wholesale.

The member is happy about the loan and is committed to making all her quota payments.

loans.use: to buy traditional products such as polo shirts, jumpers and chalinas wholesale.

loans.name: Maria Edit

texts.es:
María, vive con su hijo, quien trabaja como motorista, ella se dedica a la venta de pan dulce, hace sus ventas de manera ambulante, María no es productora de pan, sino que lo compra a una panadería de la ciudad, trabaja por las mañanas  y por las tardes.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de pan, ya que este es el ingreso con el que cuenta, teniendo dinero en efectivo podrá continuar adquiriendo pan para la reventa, esta compra le permitirá sentirse segura de su oficio.
María tiene por objetivo mantenerse en su negocio, generando ingresos para cubrir sus propias necesidades.
texts.en:
María lives with her son, who works as a driver.  She dedicates herself to selling sweet bread, and carries out her sales on foot.  María is not a bread maker, but instead buys her goods at a bakery in the city.  She works in the mornings and in the afternoons.

She is requesting a loan to purchase bread, given that this is the income she relies on.  By having cash, she will be able to continue purchasing bread for resale, which will allow her to feel secure in her business.

María’s objective is to maintain her business, generating income to cover her personal needs.

loans.use: buy a variety of sweet breads.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a 50-year-old married woman with 4 children who are all grown up.  She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Saumu has operated a retail shop for the past 6 years; her potential clients are the local area villagers.  She faces a major challenge of customer not paying their debts on time.  She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 15,000 loan, she wants to purchase 50 kilos of beans, 1 crate of milk, 50 kilos of sugar and 25 kilos of rice for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase 50 kilos of beans, 1 crate of milk, 50 kilos of sugar and 25 kilos of rice for resale.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
This is Evangeline, age 49 is a resident of Manila, Philippines.  She is married to Orlando, and a mother to their three children.  She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Evangeline operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood.  It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5 worth of cooking oil or an egg.  She earns her income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece.  Her store is located adjacent to her house.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operationing her business, she is requesting a PHP 29,000 loan.  She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.  She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Evangeline dreams to be able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es: La socia;  como es de esperar continua con su negocio desde hace mucho tiempo de venta por catalogo de productos de belleza, la socia, y también sigue apoyando y trabajando en todoa la parte logistica junto con su conyugue y la socia cobra, y apoya en lo que puede en el taller que ambos han sacado adelante, la socia desea seguir prosperando con su taller mecanico que cada vez es mas grande y tiene mas clientes, La socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de algunos productos de limpieza, y repuestos para implementar el taller.
texts.en: The member, as is to be expected, has continued with her business selling beauty products by catalog for a long time.  She continues to support and work with her husband in everything logistical.  She bills and supports the workshop that they have both gotten ahead in every area she can.  She wants their workshop to continue to prosper, as it is growing and continually has more customers.  Currently, she would like to invest the loan into the purchase of some cleaning supplies and replacement parts to outfit the workshop.

loans.use: invest in the purchase of some cleaning supplies and replacement parts to outfit the workshop.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.es:
El socio es el Sr. Virgilio, El socio alterna sus actividades diarias brindando el servicio de transporte en la ruta de Izcuchaca-Cusco el cuenta con su propio carrito para este su negocio, el socio a la vez se dedica a la ganaderia el cria lo que son toretes para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan y a la vez venderlos en las ferias de los viernes, el socio tambien se dedica a la agricultura pero se dedica a mas a la ganaderia,el socio es una persona bien alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de salir adelante.
El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar algunos repuestos que necesita su para su carro y mantenimiento del mismo.
texts.en:
The member is Virgilio. He alternates his daily activities offering a taxi service along the Izcuchaca - Cusco route. He has his own car for this business. The member, at the same time, makes a living in farming cattle. He raises young bulls to later sell them to his customers and also in the fairs on Fridays. The member also makes a living as a farmer but he is more devoted to cattle. The member is a happy and responsible person who is eager to get ahead.

The member is requesting a loan to buy some spare parts that he needs for his car and to service it.

loans.use: to buy some spare parts that he needs for his car and to service it.

loans.name: Sop Serigne Saliou Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité a été crée le 09 décembre 2010. Il est composé de 11 femmes qui se sont unies par des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d'amitié. leurs activités sont le petit commerce, la couture, l'élevage ovine et l'agriculture. 

Codou la responsable du groupe est âgée de 45 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants en charge. Codou est debout sur la photo à l’extrême droite habillé en bleu blanc. 

Elle fait le petit commerce d'habits de colliers, pagne travaillé, et des parfums. 

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va s'approvisionner en marchandise pour la continuité de son activité et satisfaire sa clientèle

son objectif est d'appuyer ses enfants et renforcer son épargne au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was established on December 9, 2010. It is made up of eleven women, who got together on the basis of bonds of kinship, neighborhood, and friendship. Their businesses are retail, sewing, raising sheep, and agriculture.

Codou, age 45, is responsible for the group. She's the one dressed in white and blue, standing on the far right in the picture. She's married and the mother of five children, whom she has to support. She retails clothes, necklaces, pagnes (colorful African cloth), and perfumes. 

She will use her new loan to purchase supplies in order to pursue her business and satisfy her clientele. Her goal is to support her children and bolster her savings at the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy clothes, pearls, and perfumes

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 39-year-old married man and the father of two children, for whom he works hard to provide a good & healthy life. He opened his shop twenty years ago, specializing in selling and repairing tires. This business is improving but needs to be updated all the time with new products and special machines.

Ahmad applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase his business merchandise through increasing his stock of tires. He hopes this loan will be invested in a successful way, and that it will affect his social and financial situation positively.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise through increasing his stock of tires.

loans.name: Jorge Geovanny

texts.es:
Jorge es un hombre de 30 años. Es casado y tiene un hijo de 10 años que cursa sus estudios primarios; Junto a su familia viven en el centro de la ciudad de Santo Domingo que es la cuarta ciudad con más población del Ecuador después de Guayaquil, Quito y Cuenca. Su población va creciendo rápidamente ya que cuenta con un rico comercio y el mayor mercado ganadero del país. La provincia tiene de superficie 3.857 km² su temperatura habitual es de unos 25.5°C  y a veces llega a los 38 °C. Toda la provincia de "Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas"  figura como parte del territorio montañoso de la costa de la cordillera occidental, históricamente conocida como Provincia de Yumbos y Capital de los Colibríes. Está ubicado en el trópico húmedo de América Latina. Es una provincia considerada nueva ya que fue creada en el 2007.

Jorge tiene un puesto de venta de ropa casual desde hace algunos años. Este oficio lo aprendió de sus familiares. El trabaja sólo ya que su esposa se dedica netamente a la crianza de su hijo y a los quehaceres del hogar; su jornada es de 10 horas al día aproximadamente. El desea invertir en más mercadería y de esta manera aprovechar la época navideña en la que las ventas son las más altas del año. Piensa en comprar prendas para aumentar el surtido y así ofertar más opciones a sus clientes y asegurar la venta. Es su primer crédito y se siente muy optimista. A pesar de que los precios han incrementado y su margen de utilidad se ha visto afectado, Jorge cree que con esta inversión puede tener buenas utilidades nuevamente.
texts.en:
Jorge is 30 years old. He is married and has a 10 year old child who attends sprimary school. He and his family live in the center of the city of Santo Domingo which is the fourth most populous city in Ecuador after Guayaquil, Quito and Cuenca. Its population is growing rapidly because it has a rich trade sector and the largest cattle market in the country. The province is 3857 km ² in area and has an average temperature of about 25.5 °C which sometimes reaches 38 °C. The whole province of "Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas" appears as part of the mountainous territory of the coast of the western mountain range, historically known as Yumbos Province and Capital de los Colibríes (capital of the hummingbirds). Located in the humid tropics of Latin America, this province is considered new since it was created in 2007.

Jorge has had a stall selling casual clothes for several years. He learned the trade from his relatives. He works alone as his wife spends all her time taking care of their child and the household chores. He works 10 hours a day approximately. He wants to invest in more merchandise and in this way take advantage of the Christmas season during which sales are the highest in the year. He is thinking of buying clothes to increase his stock and thus offer his customers more options to secure the sale. This is his first loan and he feels very optimistic. Although prices have increased and his profit margin has beeen affected, Jorge believes that with this investment he can make good profits again.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis de 33 años de edad vive en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, a orillas del mar con su esposa y su hijo de 6 años de edad; él tiene una tienda salsamentaría con la que genera el ingreso de su hogar y está ubicada al norte de la Ciudad de Barranquilla. Las épocas en las cuales hay un mayor volumen ya se acercan y estas son las fiestas navideñas y de fin de año, porque las familias se reúnen para celebrarlas y comparten deliciosos alimentos, que son preparados con productos como los que vende Luis Alberto: salsas, carnes frías, queso, panes, productos desechables, verduras etc. Así mismo sus ventas se incrementan porque también los vendedores de perros calientes, tienen puntos de venta y quieren tenerlos bien surtidos, pues a ellos también les va muy bien con sus ventas. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, con el cual comprará salsas, encurtidos, enlatados, carnes frías, panes, pudines etc. para responderle a la clientela que se potencializa en esta época y con ello lograr un crecimiento en sus inversiones de capital de trabajo, porque su mata mas adelante es abrir otra tienda en un corredor universitario de la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde desde ya está estudiando su mercado y tambien comprar un vehículo que complete el reparto de pedidos a domicilio que cada día son mayores. Su mayor desafío es la competencia, pero Luis Alberto ha aprendido a enfrentarla con buenos precios y un excelente servicio, por eso mientras siga comprando en mayor volumen sus logros se harán notar rápidamente y este es el éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en:
Luis is 33 years old and lives in the municipality of Puerto Colombia, by the sea shore, with his wife and 6 year old child. He has a deli store with which he generates the household income and which is located to the north of the city of Barranquilla. The times during which there is a greater volume of sales is approaching and these are the Christmas season and the New Year as families get together to celebrate them and share delicious food which is prepared with products such as those sold by Luis Alberto: sauces, cold cuts of meat, cheese, bread, disposable products, vegetables and so on. Likewise his sales increase because the hot dog vendors have outlets they like to have well stocked as they also do very well with their sales.

Currently, he is applying for his first Kiva loan with which he will buy sauces, pickles, tinned goods, cold cuts, bread, puddings, etc. in order to respond to potential customer demand at this time and so achieve a growth in his working capital investment as his future goal is to open another shop at the university in the city of Barranquilla, where he is already studying his market and also buying a vehicle to make home order deliveries which are growing every day. His biggest challenge is the competition but Luis Alberto has learned to face this challenge with good prices and excellent service. This is why as long as he continues to buy in bulk, the positive effects will be felt quickly and this will be to thanks to the success of his Kiva loan.

.

loans.use: to buy sauces, pickles, tinned goods, cold cuts, bread, puddings etc.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander, a 40-year-old married father of four children, earns a living from his butchery enterprise. In the business since 1998, he has one employee and says his business environment is good because he gets many customers in a day.

Since joining Faulu Kenya Alexander has been able to add stock to his business, and he is now requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy meat. His desire is to own a bigger business premise.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Aroldo

texts.es: Aroldo es un hombre de 53 años, que vive  en Puerto Colombia, con su cónyuge y tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 24 a 28 años. En  este lugar ubicado a la orilla del mar Caribe, Aroldo tiene un negocio donde ofrece lavadoras en calidad de alquiler, para que las amas de casa, puedan desempeñar su oficio mas rápidamente y ser mas eficiente en sus tareas domésticas, pues muchas veces trabajan,  y cada día es menos el tiempo que tienen para responder a las actividades de la familia. Él también aprovecha épocas especiales para elaborar productos comestibles, como pasteles, hayacas, deditos de queso y otros pasabocas, lo cual le genera un ingreso adicional.  Su actividad como emprendedora, inició hace 4 años alquilando una lavadora por espacio de horas, pero su negocio gradualmente fue creciendo, se dio a conocer en un sector donde no existía este servicio, prosperó fácilmente y hoy quiere continuar expandiéndose por todo el municipio. En la actualidad en compañía de su esposa también vende fritos todas las tardes y los fines de semana,  ubicándose en una esquina del barrio. Aroldo planea comprar 2 lavadoras mas y también invertir en insumos y materias primas para la preparación de pasteles y hayacas, productos que aumentan el consumo en  las festividades del fin de año, por eso quieren aprovecharla y ganar un poco mas de dinero que el acostumbrado. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual hará la inversión mencionada.
texts.en:
Aroldo is a 53 year old man, who lives in Puerto Colombia, with his wife and 3 children aged 24 to 28 years. In this place located at the edge of the Caribbean, Aroldo provides quality cleaning machines for hire, to housewives, so that they can do their chores faster and be more efficient with the household chores, because they sometimes work, and every day they have less time to do their household chores. He also takes advantage of special festive times to produce food products such as cakes, hayacas (typical Venezuelan Christmas tamales), fingers of cheese and other snacks, which will generate additional income. He started out as an entrepreneur 4 years ago, renting a machine by the hour, but his business gradually grew, became known in an area where there this kind of service didn't exist and easily prospered. Today he wants to continue expanding throughout the municipality. Currently, with his wife, he also sells fried food every evening and at the weekends on a corner of the neighborhood. Aroldo plans to buy 2 washings machines and also invest more in ingredients and raw materials for the preparation of cakes and hayacas, products that have an increased consumption in the year-end holidays, which is why they want to take advantage and earn a little more money than usual. This is the reason that he apraoches credikiva, his first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will make the aforementioned investment.


 .

loans.use: to buy 2 more washing machines, invest in ingredients and raw materials to make cakes and hayacas (Venezuelan Christmas tamales)'

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: El señor Antonio, tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero, reside en una comunidad rural del Municipio de Intibucá. Hace 6 años trabajaba como empleado de una sastrería, posteriormente el patrón se la vendió y en la actualidad Don Antonio es el propietario. Él anteriormente se dedicaba a la agricultura, pero cambio su actividad económica, ya que ha obtenido mejores ingresos con la confección de ropa. Él ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 16,000 lempiras para la compra de un terreno donde piensa construir su propia vivienda y continuar su actividad de confección de ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños. Don Antonio es muy optimista y piensa seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Antonio is 25 years old and single.  He lives in a rural community in the Intibucá municipality.  He worked for a tailor for six years.  The tailor then sold him the business, and Antonio is now the owner.

He used to devote himself to farming, but he changed his financial activity.  He has gotten better income by making clothes.

He has requested a loan for 16,000 lempiras to buy land where he is planning on building his own house.  He also plans on continuing to make women’s, men’s, and children’s clothing.  Antonio is very optimistic, and he plans to continue growing in his business.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Agueda

texts.es:
Agueda tiene 33 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos con las edades de 8, 10 y 12 los cuales estudian, y vive con su familia en la aldea el barrial del municipio  choloma, cortes.
Agueda trabajaba con su madre vendiendo mercadería en la calle, pero la necesidad de generar más ingresos y dedicarle mas tiempo a su familia, hace 3 años logro establecer su propio negocio de pulpería donde vende producto de la canasta básica como ser granos, refrescos, golosinas , pan, etc.
Ella ha logrado mantener su negocio con l ayuda de varios préstamos, y actualmente solicita uno de 15,000 lempiras, el cual lo invertirá en surtir su negocio con productos como frijoles, arroz, harina, huevos, azúcar, pan etc.  Y productos de abarrotería, con esta inversión espera ofrecer a sus clientes los productos necesarios y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Agueda is 33 years old and married.  She has three children, ages 8, 10, and 12; and they go to school.  She lives with her family in the El Barrial village of the Choloma municipality, Cortes.

Agueda used to sell merchandise on the street with her mother.  However, out of the necessity to generate more income and to devote more time to her family she managed to establish her own business.  She has a grocery store where she sells staples such as grains, soft drinks, sweets, and bread, etc.

She has managed to maintain her business with the help of several loans.  She is currently requesting 15,000 lempiras to stock her business with products like beans, rice, flour, eggs, sugar, bread, and other grocery products.  With this investment she hopes to offer her customers the products they need.  This way she will get improved income.

loans.use: to buy beans, flour, rice, sugar, bread, soap, and paper, etc.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a 30-year-old married woman with four children who are enrolled in school. Her husband Hamadi is a teacher who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Saumu has operated a vegetable grocery for the past five years. Her potential clients are the local area villagers. She faces a major challenge of transporting her goods from the point of purchase to her store. She dreams of establishing a farm in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase one sack of potatoes, one crate of tomatoes and one net of onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to lift her living standards and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, tomatoes and onions for resale.

loans.name: Eugenio Gregorio

texts.es: Eugenio tiene 52 años de edad, el es una taxista que todos los días sale para buscar el pan de cada día, ya tiene años en este negocio. Eugenio tiene su vivienda que la adquirió con mucho esfuerzo por tanto le quiere hacer la mejoras a su vivienda que por falta de dinero no la había realizado. Eugenio está solicitando financiamiento para realizarles las mejoras a la vivienda repara el techo y el baño entre otras mejoras que le hará con el crédito comprara materiales de construcción.
texts.en:
Eugenio, age 52, is a taxi driver.  Every day he goes looking for his daily bread.  He has had this business for years.  Eugenio has a house, which he got through great effort.  He wants to make some improvements to the house, but he has not done so due to the lack of money.

Eugenio is requesting a loan to make improvements to his house.  He will repair the roof and the bathroom and make some other improvements.  He will use the loan to buy construction materials.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is a 40-year-old married woman with five children. Her husband, Hassan, is a carpenter who contributes to the family's income. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Mwanatumu has operated a fish-selling business for the past three years. Her potential clients are the local area villagers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality: sometimes there are no fish in the sea. She dreams of establishing a seafood retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase 10 kilos of fish, a kilo of garlic and 10 liters of cooking oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to lift her living standards and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fish, garlic and cooking oil.

loans.name: Marvelyn

texts.en:
Marvelyn is 22 years old. She is from Caluya, Sapangdala Misamis Occidental. She is happily married with two school-aged children. 

Marvelyn specializes in building NIPA huts made of bamboo, rope and coconut leaves. She started her business with a small amount of capital to help her husband finding sources of income for the family. She has been in this business for two years. She has a good income: every month she has a net profit of PHP 4,350.

She joined GDMPC in 2011. She plans to use the revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase rope and bamboo to make nipa huts.

loans.name: Aghabek

texts.en:
Aghabek is 62-years-old and lives in Tsakhkunk village in the Sevan area with his wife. Aghabek’s children are married and live separately from their parents. For a long time, Aghabek worked at a state-owned cattle farm as a farm worker. 

Aghabek and his wife have been farming for over 18 years and they say they like that occupation very much. On their own farm they breed cows and calves, sheep and horses. Aghabek sells produced meat and wool from his house. 

Thanks to his farming Aghabek was able to buy a truck, which he uses to deliver fodder for his farm animals. His first Kiva loan Aghabek used to buy calves and sheep for his farm. Now he is asking for an 800.000 AMD loan to buy 7 more calves for his farm.

loans.use: to buy 7 more calves for his farm.

loans.name: Porcita

texts.en:
Porcita is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 45 years old. Porcita is married and has five children. 

To make a living, Porcita operates a family member's business venture, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Porcita has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Porcita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. Porcita is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her fishing boat. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions .

loans.use: to repair her fishing boat

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Marivic has a shop where she sells rice, and also clothing like shirts and blouses. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for 9,000 to buy sacks of rice to sell.
Marivic has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marivic hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice for sale.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis is 30 years old and is from Nakuru. He is married to Pauline and they have no children at the moment.

Dennis is an electrician and he specializes in repairing electronic goods. He has been in this business for the past three years. He has applied for a loan to help him to buy some electronic machines to help in his work.

He hopes to grow his business and start a computer cyber-cafe in the future.

loans.use: to buy some electronic machines.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is from Tabuan, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 43 years old, married, and has 4 children. To make a living, Gina operates a specialized retail store. She has been in business for 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Gina joined GDMPC to access financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Gina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
This is Carolina, 47, resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Ernie, her business partner. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

She operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most families only eat home-cooked meals during the evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons, when buying cooked rice and other prepared foods cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Carolina wants to grow the business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is from Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 32 years old. Marlyn is single and has one child. 

To make a living, Marlyn runs a general store. She has been engaged in her business for six years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Marlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marlyn is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offerings. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offerings.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a 36-year-old married woman with 4 children who are enrolled in school. Her husband, Hamadi, is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Mwanamisi has operated a food stall for the past 10 years. Her potential clients are the local area villagers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, where there are some months of the year like the month of Ramadan. She dreams of establishing a café in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase 50 kilos of beans, 50 kilos of rice, 10 kilos of sugar, 5 kilos of tea leaves and 20 liters of cooking oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to raise her living standards and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase 50 kilos of beans, 50 kilos of rice, 10 kilos of sugar, 5 kilos of tea leaves and 20 liters of cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is from Tabuan, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. She is 49 years old and married with three children. 

To make a living, Edna is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home use products in the local community. Edna has been in her business for 3 years and earns about 6,800 PHP a month for these activities.

Edna is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. In 2010, Edna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation.
