She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a 59-year-old married woman with 11 children. Her younger children still go to school. Erlinda's husband works as a farmer.

She buys and resells bananas and fish. She also makes "buwad" (dried fish), "tinabal" (fish in brine) and "ginamos" (salted fish). Erlinda earns about 3,000 Php per month with her business. She plans to use her loan to buy more bananas and more fish to dry and sell.

In the future, Erlinda hopes to have a progressive business and life.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and more fish to dry and sell.

loans.name: Nisreen

texts.en:
Nisreen is a 33-year-old woman from Al Hussein, Amman, Jordan.

Nisreen sells clothes through her home and she is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to purchase clothes for trading purposes.

Nisreen is looking to increase her sales volume and improve her family's life conditions.

Due to cultural issues, Nisreen's husband is shown in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for trading purposes.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 42-year-old married man and lives with his wife and three children in Zarqa district.

Khaled wanted to be independent and so preferred to start his own business instead of being employed. And so, he started selling basic products from his home that one would find at any local mini-market.

Wanting to prove his independence, he recently changed his project and turned it from a small home business into an actual mini-market, and he is now serving his local community, selling them their basic products.

Being ambitious, Khaled would like to get a loan to expand his market and improve the quality and variety of products in his store to serve a larger part of his community and provide a good lifestyle for his wife and his three kids.

loans.use: to expand his market and improve the quality and variety of products in his store.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en: Feliciana is 51 years old and married with 9 children. Five of her children still go to school. She and her husband are both farmers. According to Feliciana, they wake up early in the morning to prepare food for the family and then proceed to work at the farm. They primarily grow rice to sell. Feliciana works hard to support her big family. She applied for this loan to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor. In the future, Feliciana hopes to experience progress in life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Hap

texts.en:
Mrs. Hap has run a pig fattening business since 2009. In her yard, she has built a wooden pigpen where she raises a few pigs, while her husband manages all the farming work at the rice field. Hap is able to generate approximately $4.00 each day from the business to support her 3 school-age kids. 

She would like to take out this loan to purchase 3 more pigs for breeding purposes. With the remaining funds, she wants to repair her pigpen to keep her pigs safe and healthy. For her business plan, she intends expand her project and raise many pigs for both slaughter and offspring.

loans.use: to purchase 3 more pigs for breeding purposes.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a 32-year-old married woman with 6 children who are enrolled in school. Her husband, Kombora, is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither piped water nor electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Fatuma has operated a vegetable grocery for the past year. Her potential clients are the local area villagers. She faces a major challenge of customers not paying their debts on time. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase 2 crates of tomatoes, 1 sack of potatoes and 2 sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to raise her living standards and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase 2 crates of tomatoes, 1 sack of potatoes and 2 sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Maria Isabel  tiene 43 años de edad , su mayor sueño es realizarle a su casa mejoras en el cual por falta de dinero no lo había realizado, ella trabaja como obrera en una empresa langostino en el cual el poco salario que gana no puede realizar las mejora totales. Ella está solicitando financiamiento para realizar las mejoras lo cual comprar cemento, bloque, y otros materiales de construcción.
texts.en: María Isabel is 43 years old.  Her biggest dream is to make improvements on her house, which she had not done for lack of money.  She works in a prawn company in which the small salary she earns is not enough to make all the improvements.  She is requesting financing to make the improvement, to buy cement, cinderblock, and other construction materials.

loans.use: to buy cement, cinderblock, and other construction materials.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a 42-year-old widowed woman with eight children, four of whom are enrolled in school. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Fatuma has operated a fish selling business for the past fifteen years; her potential clients are the local area villagers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, where there are no fish in the sea sometimes. She dreams of being a seafood supplier in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase 20 kilos of fish, 1 kilo of garlic, 2 bundles of firewood, and 15 liters of cooking oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to uplift her living standards and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 kilos of fish, 1 kilo of garlic, 2 bundles of firewood, and 15 liters of cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 35-year-old married man and the father of one child. He has worked in furniture making for 15 years, with 21 years of experience in this field.
He is a hardworking man, and his wide experience gives him his customers' trust and support. 

He is applying for a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to improve his business through buying necessary foam products, textiles & wood. His last loan was invested in renewing his machines, and it had an excellent effect on his social & financial situation.

Ibrahim is working hard to provide the best & healthiest living for his family, and he hopes to keep on improving his business more and more.

loans.use: To buy necessary foam products, textiles & wood for his business.

loans.name: Philis Wanjiru

texts.en: Philis is 35 years old, lives in Ndunyu-Njeru, and is married to Peter. They have four children who are all in high school. Phyllis has a farm where she raises poultry and also does farming. She is applying for a third loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy farm supplies and chemicals. She hopes to expand her farming so as to boost her income.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and chemicals.

loans.name: Kyule

texts.en:
Kyule is a 57-year-old business man. He is a divorced father with two children, age 21 and 17 years. 

He has been in a livestock trading business for the past 20 years with the monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his third loan term from KADET Ltd. after paying back the previous loans successfully. He will use the loan to buy cows and goats for selling. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy a pickup for transporting the livestock to different markets.

loans.use: To buy cows and goats for sale.

loans.name: Fikiri

texts.en:
Fikiri is a 28-year-old married woman with one child who is still young for school. Her husband, Shee, is a businessman who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Fikiri has operated a vegetable grocery for the past three years. Her potential clients are the local area villagers. She faces a major challenge of transporting her goods from point of purchase to her place of business. She dreams of establishing a café in the future.

 She decided to join Yehu to access funds to uplift her living standards and expand her business. With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase more stocks of tomatoes, cabbages, potatoes, onions and spinach for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of tomatoes, cabbages, potatoes, onions and spinach for resale.

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
Kassem is a 38-year-old married man and the father of one child. 

Two years ago, Kassem opened a grocery store in his village that is attractive to most of his villagers and those passing by. Kassem is well known in the region for his special customer service, good quality items and competitive prices.

To keep on improving, Kassem applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua for the first time, in order to increase his business merchandise with seasonal fruits and vegetables, in addition to purchasing a power generator, which is necessary in his village since electricity isn't available all the time.

Kassem hopes to keep on expanding his business and to start a wholesale trade in the future.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise and to buy a generator necessary for his business.

loans.name: Silvia Pilar

texts.es: Silvia tiene 36 años de edad es conviviente con 03 hijos en etapa escolar. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida, este negocio surgió gracias a su madre, pues fue ella quien  la  motivo a emprender su negocio, actualmente sus ingresos lo destina para capital de trabajo,  gracias a su trabajo y dedicación Silvia  ha podido a poyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar y mejorar su vivienda. El deseo de Silvia es de instalar una boutique, pues así asegura ella tendrá mayores ganancias. En esta oportunidad solicito el crédito para invertir en su negocio comprando arroz, azúcar y fideos y para pagar la matrícula de colegio  de sus  hijos. Silvia está agradecida con el crédito brindado y se compromete a seguir trabajando bien con el Programa- Prosperidad.
texts.en:
Silvia, 36, lives with her partner with three school-age children.  She works selling food.  This business started thanks to her mother, since she was the one who motivated her to set up her business.

Currently her income is destined for working capital.  Thanks to her work and dedication Silvia has been able to help her partner with the household expenses and improve their home.  Silvia's desire is to set up a boutique because that way assures that she will have bigger profits.

She requested the loan now to invest in her business by buying rice, sugar, and noodles, and to pay for her children's school tuition.

Silvia is grateful for the loan offered and is committed to continuing to work well with the Prosperidad program.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and noodles.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is a 35-year-old married woman with six children who are enrolled in school. Her husband Hamadi is a farmer who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Mwanatumu has operated a food stall for the past two years; her potential clients are the local area villagers. She faces a major challenge of fluctuating prices of commodities in the market. She dreams of establishing a café in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase 35 kilos of beans, 25 kilos of rice, 10 kilos of sugar, 5 kilos of tea leaves and 10 liters of cooking oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to uplift her living standards and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase 35 kilos of beans, 25 kilos of rice, 10 kilos of sugar, 5 kilos of tea leaves and 10 liters of cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 30 years old, from Nakuru, and is a single mother of one child who is three years old.

Naomi sells groceries at her local market and has applied for a loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy more potatoes and carrots for sale.

She hopes to expand her stall and open up a shop in the near future.

loans.use: to buy potatoes and carrots for sale

loans.name: Inesa

texts.en:
Inesa is a 47-year-old married woman with 2 children. Her husband works as a farmer.

Inesa has had a sari-sari store business for 3 years. She sells items like canned goods, soft drinks, and packed noodles. Inesa also sells banana cue and other delicacies to her community. She earns about 6,500 PHP per month.

Inesa has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell, such as canned goods and soft drinks. She hopes for this loan to help improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and more items to sell, such as canned goods and soft drinks

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is aged 43 and married with  five children aged between 14 and 2 years. He has been in active farming for 20 years and current employs four farmhands, producing maize, beans, vegetables, milk and bananas for the local market. He also runs a welding shop for additional income.

Paul has requested a loan of 100,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him venture into poultry farming by building a poultry housing unit at 30,000 KES, buying poultry birds at 40,000 KES and building a modern dairy unit for his dairy cows. He believes his farming income will have a boost and be more regular with the additional of poultry which does not need a lot of water to run.

He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo's loans services but is worried about price fluctuations in the farming industry.

loans.use: To build both dairy and poultry housing units and buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is married and has five children. She is 41 years old and resides at D'ban, Calamba, Misamis, Occidental, Philippines. 

Ruth owns and operates a coconut plantation and a gardening business. She has worked for four years in this business. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. Ruth has requested a loan of PHP 6,500 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, young crops to raise. 

In 2010, Ruth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Ruth wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Horloo

texts.en:
Horloo is a 47-year-old widowed woman who lives with her three children in Uvs province in western Mongolia. When her husband died, she was left with her children. She has been running a wholesale flour business since 1988. Based on her 24 years of experience, she would like to extend the business by purchasing a big amount of flour and selling it while keeping some in storage at the market. 

As it is going to be the biggest festival, the flour sales business is really profitable for entrepreneurs. She is a really bright woman who says, ""I would like to extend my business so that I will earn more and be able to pay for my children's college and school." The total amount she is requesting is 1,300,000 MNT to buy flour at a wholesale price.

loans.use: To buy flour at a wholesale price.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is  a resident of Kitale and has been in  farming for six years, producing and selling milk, maize and horticultural products. He also runs a taxi business and a retail shop in the local market. He is married with six children aged between 12 and 5 years. He is aged 36.

Andrew has requested a  loan of 80,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him venture into poultry farming. He says he will use 40,000 KES to build a housing unit and the rest to buy poultry birds. He says the poultry business has a faster turnover and he will be able to raise income to repay the loan and take care of his family by providing basic needs like meals and education for the children. 

He lists the high cost of production as well as animal diseases and lack of  markets, especially for the dairy products, as the leading challenges in farming.

loans.use: To build a poultry housing unit and buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
This is Zenaida, 58, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married and mother to her five children. By the grace of God, she has managed to support her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Zenaida oversees operations of their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle unit that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) each day to her. Aside from this, she also operates a variety store. In her business the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 41,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts, accessories and also for the maintenance of her motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Zenaida dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and were she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit

loans.name: Mwanaulu

texts.en:
Mwanaulu is a 48-year-old widowed woman with five children, one of whom is enrolled in school. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Mwanaulu has operated a palm wine (mnazi) selling business for the past 10 years. Her potential clients are the local area villagers. She faces a major challenge of customers not paying their debts on time. She dreams of establishing a pub in the future.

With the KES 30,000 loan she wants to purchase 20 gallons of palm wine (mnazi) for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to uplift her living standards and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase 20 gallons of palm wine (mnazi) for resale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with two children aged 6 and 13. Her husband works as a construction worker.

Grace has been working as a fish vendor for three years. She earns about 4,500 PHP with her business. Grace also makes rice cakes and other delicacies that she sells in her neighborhood. Grace works hard to support her family. She plans to use her loan to buy food ingredients and more fish to sell. Grace hopes for her family's living conditions to improve.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients and more fish to sell.

loans.name: Momar

texts.fr: Monsieur Momar est âgé de 62 ans. Il vit au Sénégal. Il est marié et père de 4 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 11 et 18 ans. Il s’active dans le secteur du  commerce depuis plusieurs années et s’adonne dans la vente de cassettes, de CD audio-visuels et autres  accessoires  de portables. Il  a  choisi  son activité par passion mais surtout dans le but de se procurer des revenus et satisfaire les besoins de sa famille. Ce qui l’intéresse  le plus c’est l’aspect lucratif. Il est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC .Il sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de produits qu’il commercialise en vue de renforcer son stock et répondre favorablement a la demande de sa clientèle. Avec  l’augmentation de ses bénéfices il souhaite améliorer les conditions de vie sociale de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Momar, age 62, lives in Senegal. He's married and the father of four children, whose ages range from 11 to 18. He's been a merchant for several years, and sells tapes, audio-visual CDs, and accessories for mobile phones.

He chose this business out of passion, but mainly with the goal of earning an income to be able to provide for his family. He is mainly interested in the money-earning aspect of his business.

He's a member of one of UIMCEC branches, and he is seeking a loan of XOF 300'000 to buy products to resell. His goal is to bolster his working capital and meet customer demand.

Thanks to the expected increase of his profits, he would like to improve the social standard of living of his family.

loans.use: to buy CDs, tapes, and accessories for mobile phones

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 45-year-old married man, father of seven children. Twenty-one years ago, Ahmad started working in construction, specializing in all cement and paint work. Ahmad is a hard worker, he has a very good reputation in his area. 

Ahmad has been an Al Majmoua, Kiva partner, borrower for two cycles; his previous loan was invested in making necessary healthy changes in his house, and buying necessary products for a project he had to accomplish, and it came with a very impressive result.

Today's loan will be invested in buying necessary tools for his business. 

Ahmad will also help his daughter with her wedding preparations as much as he can. He hopes he can afford  everything his children need in the future.

loans.use: To buy necessary tools for his business

loans.name: Otgondorj

texts.en:
Otgondorj is a 42-year-old man who lives with his wife and three daughters in Tosontsengel Soum of Zavhan province. His wife is an entrepreneur; two of their girls study at secondary school and the youngest one goes to kindergarten.  He has been baking bread and selling it in the local area since 2004. He needs a specific amount of money to supply different types of bakery goods using his equipment.  

He is a nice man who says, "I want to increase the number of my product types so that the sales increase.'  He and his wife plan to have their daughter study abroad. The total amount he is requesting is 500,000 MNT for materials for the bakery.

loans.use: To purchase materials for the bakery.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a 38-year-old married woman with seven children who are enrolled in school. Her husband Juma is a farmer who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Mwanamisi has operated a food stall for the past 10 years; her potential clients are the local area villagers. She faces a major challenge of fluctuating prices of commodities in the market. She dreams of establishing a café in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase 7 kilos of beans, 10 kilos of rice, 5 kilos of sugar, 2 kilos of tea leaves and 5 liters of cooking oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to uplift her living standards and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase 7 kilos of beans, 10 kilos of rice, 5 kilos of sugar, 2 kilos of tea leaves and 5 liters of cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr: Madame Seynabou  est âgée  de 52 ans. Elle vit dans une des communautés villageoises du territoire sénégalais. Elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 17 et 35 ans. Elle est vendeuse de poissons depuis plus de 10 ans dans un marché proche de sa zone d’habitation. Elle a choisi son activité par passion et surtout  par nécessité dans le souci de soutenir financièrement sa famille. C’est le bénéfice qui l’intéresse  le plus. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCECF depuis aout 2010.elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de poissons a revendre. Son objectif est de renforcer et mieux développer son  activité. Avec l’augmentation de ses bénéfices elle souhaite améliorer les conditions de vie sociale de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Seynabou, age 52, lives in one of Senegal's village communities. She's married and the mother of seven children, whose ages range from 17 to 35.

For ten years, she's been selling fish in a market close to the neighborhood where she lives. She chose this business out of passion, and mainly out of necessity to financially support her family. She's mostly interested in the profits.

She's been a member of one of UIMCEC's branches since August 2010. She's seeking a loan of XOF 200'000, intended to buy fish to resell.

Her goal is to bolster and better develop her business. Thanks to the increase of her profits, she would like to improve her family's social standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fish to resell

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah has been in the clothing sales business in Nakuru town for the last six years.  She is 28 years old, married to Joseph, and they have two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of school uniforms and baby outfits for sale in her business.

In future, Serah hopes to expand her business and open a big mall and sell clothes and clothing materials wholesale, thereby becoming one of the best clothing dealers in Nakuru town.

loans.use: To add more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne  has been in farming in her hometown of Kitale, Western Kenya for 11 years. She produces maize and beans for the local market. She lives with her family of four children, aged between 15 and 2 years, in her hometown of Kitale and says farming is their source of livelihood.

Carolyne has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds for an expansion of her farming by venturing into poultry farming as well. She says poultry farming has become a lucrative business in the area due to availability of the market both for layers and broilers. She is looking forward to being able to meet her family basic needs with income generated from her poultry business.

She however puts emphasis on the challenges occasioned by animal diseases and more specifically for dairy and poultry farming.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Suhnorov

texts.en: Suhnorov is a 27-year-old man who lives with his wife and two daughters in Tosontsengel Soum. His wife makes traditional clothes and sells them. Their daughters go to the kindergarten. He has been running a clothing business in which he brings the products from Erlian, a neighboring city in China. He has already made permanent customers during these two years. He sells the goods, especially women's clothes, from a shop counter of the main market in the area. He is a really inovative guy who says, "I would like to run my business successfully with your help. I have further plans to extend my business and raise my family income."  The total amount he is requesting is 500,000 MNT to use to bring in goods from China.

loans.use: To purchase more goods from Erlian.
